name: Generate SEO-Optimized Titles & Meta Descriptions with Bright Data & Gemini AI

user.name: Zacharia Kimotho
user.bio: Automation expert with years of experience helping businesses improve their efficiency and productivity with smart automations that are affordable, scalable, and flexible.

description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

## What does this workflow do?

This workflow helps speed up the analysis process of the  top ranking titles and meta descriptions to identify paterns and styles that will help us rank on Google for a given keyword

## How does it work?
We provide a keyword we are interested in on our Google sheet. When executed, We scrap the top 10 pages using Bright Data serp API and analyse the style and patterns of the top ranking pages and generate a new title and meta description 

## Techncial setup
1. Make a copy of this [Google sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QU9rwawCZLiYW8nlYYRMj-9OvAUNZoe2gP49KbozQqw/edit?gid=0#gid=0)
2. Update your desired keywords on the cell/row
3. Set your Bright data credentials on the ```Fetch Google Search Results JSON``` node
4. Update the `zone` to your preset zone
5. We are getting the results as a JSON. You can update this setting on the url `https://www.google.com/search?q={{ $json.search_term .replaceAll(" ", "+")}}&start=0&brd_json=1` by removing the brd_json=1 query
6. Store the  generated results on the Duplicated sheet
7. Run the workflow

## Setting up the Serp Scraper in Bright Data
1. On Bright Data, go to the Proxies & Scraping tab
2. Under SERP API, create a new zone
3. Give it a suitable name and description. The default is serp_api
4. Add this to your account
5. Add your credentials as a header credential and rename to `Bright data API`

parameters.text:
=You are an advanced SEO strategist and content optimization engine.

Your task is to:
1. Analyze the list of top-ranking page titles and meta descriptions for a given keyword.
2. Infer common SEO patterns, content structure, and user search intent.
3. Use these insights to generate a highly optimized new **Title** and **Meta Description** that:
   - Aligns with the dominant SERP format
   - Matches search intent
   - Stands out enough to drive clicks (CTR-optimized)
   - Includes the target keyword naturally
   - Sounds trustworthy, relevant, and modern

---

### Input Keyword:
{{ $('set keyword').item.json.search_term }}
### Top SERP Results (Titles + Descriptions):
{{ $json.titlesDescriptions }}

### "People Also Ask" Questions:
{{ $json.paaQuestions }}

---

### Output Format:
{
  "intent": "[Label the dominant search intent. Examples: Listicle, How-to, Informational, Commercial, Review, Product Page, Case Study, etc.]",
  "dominant_patterns": {
  "title_structure": "[Respond only with the generalized pattern using placeholders. No full sentences. No explanations.]",
  "meta_structure": "[Respond only with the generalized meta pattern using placeholders. No full sentences. No explanations.]"
},
  "optimized_title": "[SEO-optimized title for the keyword]",
  "optimized_meta": "[Well-written meta description under 160 characters]",
  "cta": "[Optional call-to-action if helpful]"
}

parameters.content: ## Analyze title and meta description formats for top 10 pages

- Make a copy of this [G sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QU9rwawCZLiYW8nlYYRMj-9OvAUNZoe2gP49KbozQqw/edit?usp=sharing)

- Add your desired keywords
- We loop over each item one at a time

- Map keyword and country code 
- Update the Zone name to match your zone on Bright Data
- Run the scraper
